channel.title: Changing spell book teleports
channel.description:
hey well i wanna change the pk teleports in spellbook area.
I am using delta base.
Well anyways, what file do i change the cords, and the name of the teleports in the book?
Thanks..

item.title: Changing spell book teleports
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Search The Name Of Your Teleport In clickingmost.java and change the cords

Read full topic

item.title: Changing spell book teleports
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“hitman2009, post:3, topic:304884”]Click the tele you want to change ingame, and then type ::mypos to see where it teles you to. Then go into client.java and search for the coords.
So, if your coord is 3300 9999 search for 3300 in client.java and if you see “toX = 3300 toY = 9999” <— Change those to where u want it to take you.
Also, if you want to change what the teleport says, go to texthandler.java and search for the teleport name. Example: Varrock, Falador, etc.
So if the tele you’re changing is called Home, search for home and change it to whatever u want it to say. You’ll have to do this TWICE.
Hope that helps, ik it’s a bit unclear.[/quote]
ok…

just look in the clickingmost.java thats were all Action buttons are handled

Read full topic

item.title: Changing spell book teleports
item.dc:creator: @hitman2009 hitman2009
item.description:
@hitman2009 wrote:

Click the tele you want to change ingame, and then type ::mypos to see where it teles you to. Then go into client.java and search for the coords.
So, if your coord is 3300 9999 search for 3300 in client.java and if you see “toX = 3300 toY = 9999” <— Change those to where u want it to take you.
Also, if you want to change what the teleport says, go to texthandler.java and search for the teleport name. Example: Varrock, Falador, etc.
So if the tele you’re changing is called Home, search for home and change it to whatever u want it to say. You’ll have to do this TWICE.
Hope that helps, ik it’s a bit unclear.

Read full topic
